body.head: NNA019490

p.note: Publications of the Jesup North Pacific Expedition, Vol. X, pp. 196, 223.

body.p:
Then he saw a perch. "Don't come near me on the water. You are secular."That means not initiated in the winter-dance. - "I am really the greatest thrower of all,The Social Organization and the Secret Societies of the Kwakiutl Indians (Report of the U. S. National Museum for 1895, p. 485). Ōʼlalahahëʼ, great friend!" Thus he said to him. "You are a great shaman," said Q!āʼnēqīᵋlax̣ᵘ to him. "Hēʼhehehe! you only say that I sing my sacred shaman's song. I feel only glad on the water because it is calm." - "Come, friend, and let us meet," said Q!āʼnēqīᵋlax̣ᵘ to him. The perch came ashore, and his cedar-bark
head-ring was dragging along on the water. Then Q!āʼnēqīᵋlax̣ᵘ took him and put him into the water. He became a perch.
